metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1000085 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
ClamAV version version 0.99.3 contains a Out of bounds heap memory readvulnerability in XAR parser, function xar_hash_check() that can result inLeaking of memory, may help in developing exploit chains.. This attackappear to be exploitable via The victim must scan a crafted XAR file. Thisvulnerability appears to have been fixed in after commitd96a6b8bcc7439fa7e3876207aa0a8e79c8451b6.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000085` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

clamav - 0.99.4+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamav-base - 0.99.4+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamav-daemon - 0.99.4+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamav-freshclam - 0.99.4+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamav-milter - 0.99.4+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamav-testfiles - 0.99.4+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamdscan - 0.99.4+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libclamav7 - 0.99.4+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: clamav package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.99.4+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
